title: Language and Translation Awareness
objective: Recognize how original language features and translation choices affect reading

segments.audio_script: This is lesson four. We focus on language features and translation impact.
No passage required. Note how translations render key terms differently.
Original languages have grammatical and lexical nuances. Translation choices can highlight or obscure emphases.
Compare multiple translations and consult interlinear resources when necessary. Be cautious about deriving doctrine from a single translation artifact.
Key skill: translation awarenessâ€”observe how translator decisions shape perceived meaning.
What should you compare to spot translation differences?
This completes lesson four. Next lesson addresses intertextual links and citation patterns.

vocabulary.definition: Sensitivity to how translation choices affect textual meaning

study_notes: Translations are tools; original language study is ideal but translation comparison is practical and helpful.
